title: Featured jobs this week at Diller Scofidio + Renfro, Murdock Solon Architects, and March & White
author: Nathaniel Bahadursingh
excerpt: Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City and Los Angeles. For even more opportunities, visit the Archinect job...
text: anchor The Broad by Diller Scofidio + Renfro. Photo: Iwan Baan Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City and Los Angeles. For even more opportunities, visit the Archinect job board and explore our active community of job seekers, firms, and schools. New York City-based architectural firm Diller Scofidio + Renfro has two exciting positions available: a Business Development Coordinator with a minimum of two years of experience within a related practice and proficiency with Microsoft Office and Adobe InDesign; and a Proposal Manager with three to four years of experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, and CRM. Both roles require strong writing and copy-editing abilities, along with excellent communication and organizational skills. The Shed by Diller Scofidio + Renfro (in collaboration with Rockwell Group). Photo: Iwan BaanMurdock Solon Architects is seeking Architects/Interior Designers in New York City. The ideal candidate possesses excellent AutoCAD, Rhino or SketchUp, and Adobe Creative Suite skills, can select and develop interior palettes and create concept materials for client and internal presentations, and has experience with product sourcing. One should also have strong communication and organizational skills. Greenwich House by Murdock Solon Architects. Photo: Durston Saylor, Frank OudemanIn Los Angeles, March & White is looking to add an Intermediate Interior Designer to its practice with four-plus years of experience. Strong applicants will have proven skills in AutoCAD, SketchUp, Photoshop, InDesign, and Enscape, experience working in all stages of a project, proven ability to select and specify FF&E for large-scale projects, and are capable of creating and developing conceptual designs. Candidates should also have excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills, along with exceptional attention to detail. 60 London Wall by March & White. Photo: Kilian O'Sullivan PhotographerIf you don't already, follow Archinect on Facebook, X, Instagram, Pinterest, Linkedin, and Threads, as well as on our dedicated Archinect Jobs Facebook, X, Instagram, and Threads feeds.
html:
• anchor

    The Broad by Diller Scofidio + Renfro. Photo: Iwan Baan

    Take a look at our latest curated selection of architecture and design firms currently hiring on Archinect Jobs: This week's featured employer highlight includes job openings in New York City and Los Angeles.

    For even more opportunities, visit the Archinect job board and explore our active community of job seekers, firms, and schools.

    New York City-based architectural firm Diller Scofidio + Renfro has two exciting positions available: a Business Development Coordinator with a minimum of two years of experience within a related practice and proficiency with Microsoft Office and Adobe InDesign; and a Proposal Manager with three to four years of experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, and CRM. Both roles require strong writing and copy-editing abilities, along with excellent communication and organizational skills.

    Murdock Solon Architects is seeking Architects/Interior Designers in New York City. The ideal candidate possesses excellent AutoCAD, Rhino or SketchUp, and Adobe Creative Suite skills, can select and develop interior palettes and create concept materials for client and internal presentations, and has experience with product sourcing. One should also have strong communication and organizational skills.

    In Los Angeles, March & White is looking to add an Intermediate Interior Designer to its practice with four-plus years of experience. Strong applicants will have proven skills in AutoCAD, SketchUp, Photoshop, InDesign, and Enscape, experience working in all stages of a project, proven ability to select and specify FF&E for large-scale projects, and are capable of creating and developing conceptual designs. Candidates should also have excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills, along with exceptional attention to detail.

    If you don't already, follow Archinect on Facebook, X, Instagram, Pinterest, Linkedin, and Threads, as well as on our dedicated Archinect Jobs Facebook, X, Instagram, and Threads feeds.
